anyOf.description: A grouping element for purchase orders. orderTypeCode is commonly used in OM Category filters.

orderNumber.description: Order number. Identifier typically generated by the system in which the order is created.

anyOf.description: Party that is the accountable buyer of the goods/services in the referred business document. The purchaseOrganizationCode does not have an impact to the matching process.

externalCode.description: Identifies the order for future updates through Basware API. Typically Generated by the system calling Basware API.

sourceSystem.description: Identifies the source system from where the purchase order is originated

anyOf.description: Company name.
anyOf.example: Amazing Store Central City, Phoenix, Arizona

anyOf.description: Indicates whether the purchase order is invoiced. By default, the field does not impact the matching logic in P2P.
Description of purchase order.
Name of supplier sending the invoice.

supplierCode.description: Supplier code to which the order is placed. The supplier of the goods/services in the referred business document.

anyOf.description: Date when the validity of the purchase order starts. Valid values are in format: CCYY-MM-DD. If the time zone is known, it must be represented with +hh:mm or -hh:mm or Z (which means UTC). If the time zone is not known, it must be left empty. By default, the field does not impact the matching logic in P2P.

lastUpdated.description: Timestamp when the record was last sent to API. Set automatically.

organizationElementCode.description: Identifier for an administrative organization element on top of the the company set for the purchase order. The organization element is used to identify if the user has rights to see the purchase order in Basware P2P Matching view.

anyOf.description: Name of the purchase organization unit

Identifier for the agreed payment term that is to be used when supplier charges the customer. Required if using matching validation rule to check payment term on order is same as on invoice. By default, this field does not impact the matching logic in P2P.

Date when the validity of the purchase order ends. Valid values are in format: CCYY-MM-DD. If the time zone is known, it must be represented with +hh:mm or -hh:mm or Z (which means UTC). If the time zone is not known, it must be left empty. By default, the field does not impact the matching logic in P2P.

companyCode.description: Company code. Identifier for an organization element that represents the legal structure of an organization. A purchase order company is compared with the values set in the company filter when the system identifies the correct matching configuration to be used. It is also used when searching purchase orders to be matched by the system or a user.

anyOf.description: Name of the supplier.

Date when goods/services were delivered. Valid values are in format: CCYY-MM-DD. If the time zone is known, it must be represented with +hh:mm or -hh:mm or Z (which means UTC). If the time zone is not known, it must be left empty.
Supplier code of supplier sending the invoice. In some cases may be different from the main supplierCode.

The date when the purchase order was issued. Valid values are in format: CCYY-MM-DD. If the time zone is known, it must be represented with +hh:mm or -hh:mm or Z (which means UTC). If the time zone is not known, it must be left empty.

Custom field in the business document. Valid values are in format: CCYY-MM-DD. If the time zone is known, it must be represented with +hh:mm or -hh:mm or Z (which means UTC). If the time zone is not known, it must be left empty.

Custom field in the business document. Valid values are in format: CCYY-MM-DD. If the time zone is known, it must be represented with +hh:mm or -hh:mm or Z (which means UTC). If the time zone is not known, it must be left empty.

Custom field in the business document. Valid values are in format: CCYY-MM-DD. If the time zone is known, it must be represented with +hh:mm or -hh:mm or Z (which means UTC). If the time zone is not known, it must be left empty.

Custom field in the business document. Valid values are in format: CCYY-MM-DD. If the time zone is known, it must be represented with +hh:mm or -hh:mm or Z (which means UTC). If the time zone is not known, it must be left empty.

Custom field in the business document. Valid values are in format: CCYY-MM-DD. If the time zone is known, it must be represented with +hh:mm or -hh:mm or Z (which means UTC). If the time zone is not known, it must be left empty.
Indicates whether the purchase order is delivered. By default, the field does not impact the matching logic in P2P.
Indicates whether the purchase order is closed. Not inherited to order lines, which have their own indicator. Informative field.
Custom field in the business document

Name of the payment term
Custom field in the business document
Custom field in the business document

Date when goods/services are expected to be delivered. Valid values are in format: CCYY-MM-DD. If the time zone is known, it must be represented with +hh:mm or -hh:mm or Z (which means UTC). If the time zone is not known, it must be left empty.
Custom field in the business document

Custom field in the business document
Custom field in the business document

Reference to parent order. Allows an invoice to be matched to child order(s) under the parent order. Intended for scenarios where one order number is given to supplier while customer keeps generating new orders, which are still matched using the parent order number given to supplier. This method of matching is by default not enabled and needs to be manually activated in P2P.
Custom field in the business document

Custom field in the business document

currencyCode.description: Currency presentation of the purchase order document. Valid values are in ISO 4217 Alpha format.

anyOf.description: Name of the organization element.
Custom field in the business document
